poem:
**Cuffs and Questions**

In the hush of wrought corridors,  
Lander falters—unseen agents—  
a city's pulse bound in iron.  
Questions flutter, like leaves  
caught in an unsanctioned breeze.  

Masks shroud the eyes of law,  
yet the air hangs ripe with words.  
Silent papers rustle, unwritten,  
their ink blurring in protest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Top New York official Brad Lander’s arrest is ‘fascism’, says mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani – US politics live 6.06pm BST In this video posted to X by a NY1 reporter, it is apparent that New York City mayoral candidate Brad Lander was cuffed and detained by masked Ice agents after asking to see a warrant for people he was escorting from an immigration hearing. .@bradlander just arrested at immigration court pic.twitter.com/nDqEK1Lzcw— Courtney Gross (@courtneycgross) June". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
